decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creature auras, boosting them up and granting additional abilities. By utilizing cards like Abundant Growth and Utopia Sprawl for mana acceleration, along with cards like Ethereal Armor and Armadillo Cloak to beef up creatures, this deck aims to deal heavy damage efficiently and effectively. With a mix of evasion, lifelink, and protection spells, this aggro deck is designed to be fast, aggressive, and difficult to deal with for the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures, utilizing cards like Battle Screech, Guardians' Pledge, and Thraben Inspector to quickly build a strong board presence. With a mix of flying creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Eagles of the North, as well as combat tricks like Prismatic Strands and Thraben Charm, this deck aims to close out games quickly by attacking relentlessly. The inclusion of cards like Dawnbringer Cleric and Spider-Man, Web-Slinger provide additional utility and flexibility to adapt to different matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Gates to ensure mana fixing and card advantage, while also running a variety of counterspells and removal spells. The deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan with cards like Journey to Nowhere and Prismatic Strands, while gradually building up to a win condition with creatures like Squadron Hawk and Guardian of the Guildpact. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent through efficient control and strategic card choices.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. By combining aggressive creatures like Sneaky Snacker and Voldaren Epicure with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. Additionally, cards like Alms of the Vein and Grab the Prize provide additional reach and disruption to help secure the win.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and disruption, while utilizing cheap card draw and graveyard interaction to fuel the powerful creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Murmuring Mystic. The deck aims to establish board presence with efficient creatures and protect them with a range of counterspells. The inclusion of Lórien Revealed allows for extra card advantage and potential for tempo swings. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently controlling the game and overpowering with powerful threats.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card advantage through card draw and manipulation. Augur of Bolas and Faerie Seer help dig for essential cards, while Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite provide protection against opponents' threats. Bojuka Bog and Snuff Out deal with graveyard strategies, while Gurmag Angler and Ninja of the Deep Hours offer win conditions. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans and outvalue them through efficient spellcasting.

The main focus of this deck is to swarm the battlefield with quick, efficient elves and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures. By utilizing mana dorks like Arbor Elf and Priest of Titania, players are able to quickly ramp up to powerful finishers like Nyxborn Hydra and Timberwatch Elf. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to refill the hand with even more elves, ensuring a constant stream of threats. Masked Vandal provides utility by removing opposing artifacts and enchantments, while Wellwisher helps to stabilize against aggressive strategies.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through various removal spells and creatures that can efficiently handle threats. It also emphasizes generating value through card draw and sacrificing creature tokens. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents by consistently clearing threats and gaining incremental advantages. The Golgari / Jund color combination provides a good mix of removal, creature threats, and card advantage. The deck also includes some key recursion elements to ensure consistency and resilience in longer games.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of various gates and spells. By utilizing counterspells and removal cards, the player can limit their opponent's options while building up their own board presence with creatures like Squadron Hawk and Sacred Cat. The Gates serve as mana fixing and can also provide additional benefits when activated. Overall, the goal is to maintain control of the game and outlast the opponent until a win condition can be achieved.

This deck focuses on quickly getting cards into the graveyard to enable powerful reanimation effects. By utilizing cards like Circle of the Land Druid and Satyr Wayfinder to fill the graveyard, the deck aims to consistently bring back high-impact creatures like Lotleth Giant and Scrapwork Mutt with Dread Return. Malevolent Rumble and Molten Gatekeeper provide additional ways to cheat creatures into play, while cards like Momentary Blink and Town Greeter help to further fuel the graveyard. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful reanimated creatures.

The deck focuses on using various cards to get creatures into the graveyard and then bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo. Cards like Circle of the Land Druid and Khalni Garden help with ramping and generating tokens, while Dread Return and Malevolent Rumble allow for reanimating creatures quickly. Lotleth Giant and Scrapwork Mutt provide strong finishers, while Satyr Wayfinder and Stinkweed Imp help fill up the graveyard. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient reanimation strategy.

The main concept of this Golgari/Jund Garden Control deck is to control the board through removal spells like Cast Down, Snuff Out, and Pestilence while generating value from sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Hunt for Specimens. The deck focuses on card advantage with Ichor Wellspring and Lembas, as well as graveyard hate with Bojuka Bog and Nihil Spellbomb. The deck also includes ways to gain life with Pulse of Murasa and Campfire, making it resilient against aggressive strategies. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient removal and resource management.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells and creatures to apply constant pressure to the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan with targeted removal and hand disruption. The deck aims to outpace the opponent by quickly deploying threats and maintaining card advantage through card draw effects and recursion. The deck's synergy between sacrificing artifacts, creatures, and lands allows for flexible play patterns and enables various win conditions, such as overwhelming the opponent with a wide board or burning them out with direct damage.

The main focus of this red aggro deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of direct damage spells and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Galvanic Blast, along with creatures like Kessig Flamebreather and Voldaren Epicure, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and consistent damage output. Additionally, cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Clockwork Percussionist provide additional value and flexibility in combat. This deck prioritizes speed and aggression in order to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The key idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the Tireless Tribe combo, utilizing cards like Inside Out and Wedding Invitation to pump up the tribe's power and win the game in a single swing. The deck also includes control elements like Circular Logic and Dispel to protect the combo, as well as card draw and filtering spells to find combo pieces efficiently. The Snow-Covered lands provide additional versatility, while Squadron Hawk provides a backup plan for generating card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo quickly and protect it long enough to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Urzatron combo of Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower to generate massive amounts of mana for powerful Control plays. It includes various 1-mana artifacts to help with mana fixing and card draw, as well as ways to sacrifice artifacts for value. Malevolent Rumble is included as a win condition that benefits from the high artifact count in the deck. The deck aims to control the game with removal and disruption until it can establish its mana base and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells.
